data.message: The application accepts potentially user-controlled input `data` which can control the location of the current window context. This can lead two types of vulnerabilities open-redirection and Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS) with JavaScript URIs. It is recommended to validate user-controllable input before allowing it to control the redirection.

location.lines: console.error(`[WhatsApp] Error during auto-restart for ${providerId}:`, error);

data.message: Detected string concatenation with a non-literal variable in a util.format / console.log function. If an attacker injects a format specifier in the string, it will forge the log message. Try to use constant values for the format string.
